home.intro_p1: We are UnxWares, a French company based in Normandy, with a data center located in Caen. We work extensively to allow anyone who wishes to benefit from our expertise, even with a sometimes limited budget.
home.intro_p2: That's why we offer, via UnxWares Cloud, ready-to-use and custom hosting solutions, so that our clients can select the option best suited to their needs, at a fair price.
home.intro_p3: Thanks to the passion and creativity of the UnxWares Studio team, we also ensure the complete creation of your projects, whether websites, software, applications, APIs, or video games. For the realization of these projects, we collaborate with an exceptional internal team as well as certified independent developers. We guarantee them fair compensation and take care of the complete project management, so they can fully focus on technical implementation.
home.intro_p4: We aspire to be a model of excellence and ethics in our sector, and that's why we make it a point of honor to combine quality, transparency and innovation in all our services.
home.intro_p5: Learn more about us, our certifications, our commitment, our infrastructure and the technologies we implement to satisfy you by browsing this site, including a visual reconstruction of our infrastructure, and discovering our technical choices and ethical partners.

why.title: What sets us apart
why.intro: The current market forces you to choose between American giants (powerful but opaque and subject to the Cloud Act), low-cost (accessible but without quality guarantee or support) or technical complexity (Kubernetes has become essential, but difficult to master). We offer an alternative.
why.diff1_desc: Data center in Caen, CNCF certified infrastructure, managed services included. We develop our own orchestration technologies to control performance and costs, without dependency on proprietary licenses.
why.diff2_desc: Development and consulting on neo-languages (Rust, Go, Zig) in critical shortage on the market. Supporting companies in their transition to Cloud Native with a team that truly understands these technologies.
why.diff3_desc: Public documentation of our infrastructure, flat-rate pricing without hidden fees, technologies and technical choices explained. No misleading marketing, just solid technology.
why.diff4_desc: Our model is inspired by Odoo: the code will be free for learning and small projects, companies pay for managed services and SLA support. The community contributes and audits, creating a virtuous circle of quality and security.

whatisit.title: What is UnxWares?
whatisit.intro: UnxWares SAS (registered on June 3, 2025 with the Paris Trade Registry) is a French software development and hosting company born from something very simple: two tech enthusiasts who were tired of depending on opaque, expensive, sometimes incompetent infrastructures, and who wanted to do everything themselves.
whatisit.founders_intro: Let's not lie: UnxWares is fundamentally a story about tech people. Behind UnxWares, there are:
whatisit.founder_baptiste_profile: Infrastructure & dev architect, passionate about deep understanding. Doesn't look at a project just through Excel spreadsheets — he wants to understand down to the firmware.
whatisit.founder_david_profile: Technical and analytical mind, passionate about rigor and excellence. A methodical and precise eye on every project.
whatisit.context: This project is anything but an idea from an incubator, anything but a PowerPoint "startup" project. It was born because we were fed up. Fed up with hosting providers selling dreams, fed up with technical negligence, fed up with absurd prices "because everyone does it". And that changes everything: UnxWares is not a company founded by salespeople who then looked for developers. It's the opposite. We started from the technical side, then put a framework around it.
whatisit.objective: To offer a French, sovereign, honest, highly technical, yet accessible alternative, continuing what companies like Infomaniak do... but pushing even further the idea of "mastering everything yourself", including the orchestrator, the network, and business components.
whatisit.diff1_others: Founded by salespeople looking for devs
whatisit.diff1_unxwares: Founded by technicians who structured the company
whatisit.diff3_unxwares: Prices based on real costs, not on "what others do"
whatisit.positioning_intro: Our positioning can be summed up in one sentence:
whatisit.positioning_quote: We want to do cloud and software the way we would have liked others to do it before us.
whatisit.positioning_outro: We're in the ethical movement of Infomaniak, pushed to its maximum. Because fundamentally, we the founders are techies, we're passionate about tech, so we don't have a businessman's perspective. We want to build something good, not just something profitable.

howbegan.title: 1. How it all began
howbegan.intro: Even though the SummumNetwork project (02/10/2022 - 02/10/2024) is in our DNA — because that's where we learned what it means to develop everything ourselves, to integrate custom Minecraft APIs, and to push features never seen before — we don't want UnxWares' story to start with that.
howbegan.awareness_intro: UnxWares' story really begins in 2023, when we told ourselves:
howbegan.awareness_quote:
"We no longer want to depend on hosting providers who do things "like everyone else" and who have practices that don't suit us.
We want our own infrastructure, our own way of orchestrating, our way of doing cloud, and we want to share it.
We know we have skills, which we acquired by not wanting to do things like everyone else, let's use them to change things and design another way of hosting and developing."
howbegan.hardware_intro: At that time, we were running on a Ryzen 7 3700X, we even came from a setup where an i5-8500 literally died, and despite that we already had something very clear: we will move to professional hardware, to infrastructure hosted in France, to Kubernetes/Proxmox, but without falling into the "we charge because we can" model.
howbegan.hardware_i5_context: First tests, the processor burned out
howbegan.hardware_pro: HPE ProLiant DL360 Gen8/Gen9, Threadripper, Ryzen 9 9900X
howbegan.vff_intro: At the same time, we launched VFF Project: because we're not just a cloud company, we're also people who love documenting the real world. VFF is a French railway encyclopedia, community-driven, that wants to catalog lines, stations, archives, photos, plans, with meter-level precision, based on OpenStreetMap. It's not a small side-project: it's a concrete example of what the UnxWares community should be.
howbegan.summum_intro: Even if we don't want our story to start with SummumNetwork, we need to talk about it because that's where we forged our technical expertise:
howbegan.summum_point1: 100% custom Minecraft project: entirely developed on Forge with in-house APIs
howbegan.summum_point2: Never-seen-before features: we pushed Minecraft Java to its technical limits
howbegan.summum_point3: First confrontation with hosting providers: that's where we understood that the hosting market had serious problems
howbegan.summum_point4: Stopped in February 2024: we felt that Minecraft Java had no future and that the ecosystem was heading in the wrong direction
howbegan.summum_outro: This experience gave us the desire to create UnxWares Studio and develop our own game with Unreal Engine 5, rather than remaining dependent on the Minecraft ecosystem.

whycreated.title: 2. Why we created UnxWares

whycreated.finding1_problem: Consumer hosting providers are too simplistic: it works as long as you want a WordPress or a small VPS. For bigger needs, you need a serious budget!
whycreated.finding1_response: We offer solutions adapted to all needs, with real technical expertise behind them
whycreated.finding2_problem: Professional hosting providers are often too expensive or too closed: "we don't explain much about what we do, but it's 4× more expensive"
whycreated.finding2_response: Total transparency about our infrastructure, our technical choices, and prices based on real costs
whycreated.finding3_problem: Many surf the market without real technical value: same infrastructure as the neighbor, but over-packaged
whycreated.finding3_response: In-house Go orchestrator, thoughtfully designed and documented architecture, real technical added value
whycreated.finding4_problem: Sovereignty is often a marketing argument: they put "France" on the page, but behind it's poorly documented
whycreated.finding4_response: Datacenter in Caen, publicly described infrastructure, explained technical choices
whycreated.finding5_problem: Widespread incompetence: we personally experienced really incompetent people just trying to make money
whycreated.finding5_response: A team of passionate technicians who truly understand what they're doing
whycreated.finding6_problem: Commercial illusion: some actors prioritize appearance with flashy dashboards but little technical substance behind
whycreated.finding6_response: No pretense, technical substance before appearance

whycreated.wanted2: be transparent (say what we run on, show server ranges, talk about Fortinet firewall, MikroTiks, SLAs, not do magic)
whycreated.wanted3: be accessible to developers (you can talk Go, Rust, Laravel, SvelteKit with us, we'll know how to answer, at least we'll have the knowledge to understand you)
whycreated.wanted4: propose a new, more ethical and virtuous work model, that allows everyone to win. Less complexity for clients, with a single point of contact, less talk for developers who can do what they love
whycreated.wanted5: and especially not play the commercial illusion game ("we do the same as GAFAM but with a purple dashboard")
whycreated.positioning: Our positioning can be summed up in one sentence:
whycreated.positioning_quote: We want to do cloud and software the way we would have liked others to do it before us.
whycreated.value1_meaning: Infrastructure in France, administered by us, independent from GAFAM
whycreated.value2_meaning: No misleading marketing: our servers, our technologies, our limits are public
whycreated.value3_meaning: No excessive promises: real numbers, optimized configurations
whycreated.value4_meaning: Refurbished hardware, eco-responsible practices, no data reselling
whycreated.value5_meaning: An authentic open source culture, not cosmetic
whycreated.value7_meaning: We build each project as if it were our own
whycreated.value8_meaning: We want to create a community, not just customers

today_uwc.title: 3. What we do today
today_uwc.subtitle: 3.1 UnxWares Cloud: the real infrastructure
today_uwc.intro: Our infrastructure is described in detail on the Datacenter page of the site. It relies on:
today_uwc.location_value: Datacenter in Normandy (Caen) – sovereign hosting, GDPR compliance, 100% French data
today_uwc.internal_value: HPE ProLiant Gen8 for the internal backbone (admin, monitoring, orchestration)
today_uwc.network_value: 10 Gb/s OM4 fiber, Fortinet FortiGate 100E + MikroTik CCR2004 + CRS317 10G – a real professional network, not a lab setup
today_uwc.range_services_usage: Client hosting of all types (Nextcloud, APIs, self-hosted services...)
today_uwc.range_webdb_hardware: Threadripper + NVMe 990 EVO + 24 TB HDD 7200rpm RAID10
today_uwc.range_webdb_usage: Databases / very heavy sites requiring high throughput
today_uwc.philosophy: What you need to understand: we deliberately chose recent refurbished hardware (less than 10 years old) to reduce carbon footprint and stay within a healthy budget, without compromising performance. It's assumed, it's written on the site, and it brings us closer to Infomaniak than to OVH or Scaleway in philosophy.
today_uwc.alignment_p1: Moreover, we try as much as possible to be in the movement of the Linux Foundation and the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF), which are organizations that support the technologies we use — open, transparent technologies, independent from GAFAM.
today_uwc.alignment_p2: This means we value the idea of technological sovereignty without GAFAM dependency, which aligns with the LF's vision of an open and community ecosystem. Moreover, the CNCF has certified the technologies we use for our cloud, such as Kubernetes, Helm, ArgoCD... which proves that we try as much as possible to create a solid infrastructure that respects standards, and which is not a shaky infrastructure like some other hosting providers.
today_uwc.alignment_p3: (We specify that we unfortunately do not display the logos of these major foundations because it requires an annual subscription that we cannot afford because we want to put that money, those thousands of euros, into our infrastructure and into the proper development of UnxWares.)
today_uwc.sla: Target SLA: 99.5% — honest, realistic, not marketing. We don't promise you 99.99% if we can't deliver it. We prefer to be honest about our real capabilities.

today_uws.subtitle: 3.2 UnxWares Studio: create, innovate, propel
today_uws.intro_p1: Starting in 2024, we formalized UnxWares Studio. The goal: to put our Dev expertise at the service of client projects (and our own).
today_uws.intro_p2: UnxWares Studio is our development division. It embodies the "creation" part of our ecosystem, and allows us to bring professional-quality applications, websites and video games to life.
today_uws.tech_laravel_examples: UnxWares Cloud client panel (auth, billing, OIDC Provider, rights)
today_uws.tech_svelte_examples: The main UnxWares site (the one you're reading), client showcase sites
today_uws.tech_ue5_examples: Our own game, replacing our dependency on Minecraft Java
today_uws.tech_flutter_examples: Client apps iOS / Android / Desktop in a single codebase
today_uws.why_intro: Because there are clients who want a single point of contact:
today_uws.why_quote: "I want an app + I want it hosted + I want someone to monitor it + I want someone for CI/CD"
today_uws.why_p1: We can do everything, because we have Cloud + Studio. No intermediaries, no compromise. We develop, we host, we maintain, we monitor. From code to production, everything goes through us.
today_uws.why_p2: We want to offer each client — individual, company, institution — a custom solution, integrating development, hosting and complete follow-up.
today_uws.freelance_intro: We regularly work with freelancers and independents, but in a different way from traditional agencies:
today_uws.freelance_step1_desc: The client comes with a need (app, site, API, infrastructure)
today_uws.freelance_step2_desc: UnxWares plays the role of conductor: scoping, planning, security, hosting, CI/CD
today_uws.freelance_step3_desc: They don't have to chase the client to get paid: we pay them in a planned framework, we feed them with technical context, we provide them with infrastructure
today_uws.freelance_step4_desc: They don't suffer from "the freelancer who's late", because we provide human redundancy like we provide server redundancy
today_uws.freelance_step5_desc: Freelancers work on our stacks (Laravel, Go, SvelteKit, Kubernetes), so we keep homogeneous code
today_uws.whowins_client_benefit: Few delays, controlled infrastructure, direct support, single point of contact
today_uws.whowins_freelance_benefit: No arm wrestling over billing, technical context provided, ready-to-use environment
today_uws.whowins_unxwares_benefit: Delivery quality, homogeneous code, long-term trust relationship
today_uws.approach: It's a hybrid approach between agency, cooperative and tech studio: human, efficient, without administrative overhead.

today_unx.subtitle: 3.3 The in-house Go orchestrator
today_unx.intro: Where we really differentiate ourselves is that we don't just use third-party software to run the cloud. We developed our own Go orchestrator.
today_unx.layer1_role: Authentication, billing, OIDC Provider, rights management
today_unx.layer2_role: Receiving orders from the panel, coordinating actions on the infrastructure
today_unx.layer3_role: Executing deployments, managing VMs and containers
today_unx.layer4_role: Does one thing: deploy. No business logic, to reduce attack surface
today_unx.security: Everything is segmented for security: no direct DB → hypervisor connection. Each layer only talks to the next. It's a modern, modular, auditable architecture, built to grow.
today_unx.opensource_intro: On our GitHub, we clearly explain our position:
today_unx.opensource_point3: yes, we want it to be reusable,
today_unx.opensource_point4: no, we don't want to be industrially copied.
today_unx.opensource_policy: So we systematically add a notice like:
today_unx.opensource_quote: "The code is published, you can be inspired by it, modify it, contribute, but the intellectual property remains with UnxWares. Any as-is reuse for commercial purposes is prohibited."
today_unx.pp_site_why: Useful for learning, can inspire other devs
today_unx.pp_raiemus_why: Community project, lightweight OS for everyone
today_unx.pp_orch_why: Critical code, business core, attack surface
today_unx.pp_conclusion: It may seem paradoxical, but it's very simple: we are a company, we must protect our assets. We are pro-open source, we want people to be able to learn, contribute, build on it. But we have critical code → it remains private, to avoid exploitation of vulnerabilities. It's logical.
today_unx.association_intro: That's why we want to create the UnxWares OpenSource association (association under the 1901 law, supported by UnxWares SAS):
today_unx.association_return: 5 to 10% temporary commission on revenues when the project works, to reinject into the community and help the next one
today_unx.association_p1: It's a very different model from a traditional incubator: we don't buy the company, we don't take control, we just help get started.
today_unx.association_p2: This self-sustaining model wants to break with the logic of financial dependency: help, launch, liberate.
today_unx.project_vff_desc: French community railway encyclopedia — open and closed lines, period plans, photos, archives, kilometer points, OSM traces to the meter. Open data, meter-level precision via OpenStreetMap.
today_unx.project_vff_status: In development (mostly solo for now), launched in October 2023
today_unx.project_raiemus_desc: Operating system based on ArchLinux, lightweight and optimized, designed for RDP / remote PC. Transforms a small PC into a performant terminal capable of connecting to a more powerful machine.
today_unx.project_raiemus_status: On pause (UnxWares takes a lot of time), planned for community opening
today_unx.project_orch_desc: Our own cloud orchestrator in Go and the associated deployment API — designed to be modular, secure and documented.
today_unx.project_panel_desc: Laravel client area with auth, billing, OIDC Provider and rights management. Interface for all UnxWares Cloud services.
today_unx.project_game_desc: Our own game on Unreal Engine 5. Rather than remaining dependent on the Minecraft Java ecosystem which, in our opinion, is heading in the wrong direction.
today_unx.projects_conclusion: What characterizes our community projects: a useful, reusable, documented, community project. That's exactly what we want for the UnxWares community.
today_unx.diff1: We are techies first. We know what a FortiGate 100E is, an OM4 fiber, latency to Scaleway, we mounted them ourselves.
today_unx.diff2: We didn't copy competitors' prices. We started from real needs, not from an OVH-like grid.
today_unx.diff3: We publish code. Not just a landing page.
today_unx.diff4: We have a real datacenter story, not "we're in the cloud" without saying where. (→ Caen, France, 10 Gb/s, multi-level backups, Proxmox + Kubernetes.)
today_unx.diff5: We want to create a community, not just customers.
today_unx.diff6: We assume protecting certain components. Critical code remains private, we assume it, and it's for everyone's security.
today_unx.diff7: We do software AND infrastructure. Few actors seriously do both. With us, the dev who coded the API is the same one who understands how it runs on the server.
today_unx.diff8: We favor refurbished hardware. An ecological and responsible choice that sets us apart from major players, without compromising performance.
today_unx.diff9: We follow CNCF and Linux Foundation standards. Not out of conformism, but because these are technologies that correspond to our vision of an open ecosystem.

neolang.title: Our Neo-Languages Expertise
neolang.intro: Neo-languages (Rust, Go, Zig) represent the future of software development: native performance, memory safety, optimized compilation. We master these technologies which are rare in the French market and support companies in their adoption.
neolang.why_intro: The market is saturated with JavaScript and PHP developers, but skills in Rust, Go and Zig are critically scarce. These languages offer decisive advantages:
neolang.perf_desc: 10 to 100 times faster than interpreted languages, with reduced memory consumption. Ideal for critical systems, high-load APIs, and real-time applications.
neolang.security_desc: Rust eliminates memory management bugs (use-after-free, null pointers) at compile time. Go simplifies with an efficient garbage collector. Result: fewer vulnerabilities, more reliability.
neolang.modern_desc: Integrated package managers (Cargo, Go modules), fast compilation, native testing, automatically generated documentation. The ecosystem is designed for productivity.
neolang.concurrency_desc: Go was created for concurrency (goroutines). Rust offers concurrency without data races guaranteed at compile time. Perfect for distributed systems and microservices.
neolang.rust_desc: The most loved language by developers (StackOverflow Survey). We use it for our system tools, our security components, and any code requiring absolute reliability. Zero-cost abstraction, zero compromise.
neolang.rust_use: Critical systems, CLI tools, high-performance backends, WebAssembly
neolang.go_desc: The language of modern infrastructure (Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform). We use it for our microservices, our cloud orchestrator, and all our high-performance APIs. Simple to learn, powerful in production.
neolang.zig_desc: The spiritual successor to C, with a modern approach to systems programming. Not yet mature for critical production, but we're exploring it for our future low-level projects and as an alternative to C/C++.
neolang.zig_use: Systems programming, C replacement, low-level tools

process.title: Our Working Process
process.intro: From idea to production, we follow a proven process that combines agility, quality and transparency. You stay in control at every step.
process.step1_desc: We start by understanding your needs, constraints, and objectives. No unnecessary technical jargon, just a frank discussion about what you want to achieve and how to get there.
process.step2_desc: We provide you with a detailed technical architecture, with recommended technologies, realistic timelines, and transparent budget. No surprises, no hidden fees.
process.step3_desc: We develop in short iterations with regular demos. You can track progress, test features, and adjust course if needed. Real agility, not cosmetic.
process.step4_desc: Unit tests, integration tests, code review, security analysis. We don't deliver shaky code. Quality is non-negotiable.
process.step5_desc: We deploy on our infrastructure or yours, configure CI/CD, and train your team. You're autonomous, but we remain available.
process.step6_desc: Direct technical support from the developers who created your project. No level 1 reading from a script, just real technical expertise.

internal.intro_p1: At the heart of our technical ecosystem, three HPE ProLiant DL360p Gen8 servers constitute the backbone of our operations. These machines, true nerve centers, orchestrate global administration, real-time monitoring and management of all our client environments.
internal.intro_p2: This base infrastructure is not just a technical choice, it's a commitment to stability. The ProLiant Gen8, recognized for their exceptional reliability under intensive use conditions, guarantee seamless operational continuity. Their redundant architecture and proactive monitoring capability allow us to anticipate and prevent incidents before they affect your services. Moreover, a huge quantity of spare parts exist, which allows us to easily replace potentially failing parts while always ensuring continuous service.
internal.intro_p3: The entire internal infrastructure operates in high availability mode, with automatic failover mechanisms and 24/7 monitoring that allows us to intervene proactively. This proactive approach constitutes the foundation on which rests the trust our clients place in us.

services.intro_p2: This range embodies our service philosophy: simultaneously offering standardized solutions for fast and efficient deployments, and custom architectures accompanied by complete managed services. Whether you're a fast-growing startup or an established company with complex needs, our Services range adapts to your pace and requirements.
services.intro_p3: The Kubernetes orchestration deployed on this infrastructure guarantees you an exceptional user experience: automatic scalability according to load, native high availability with transparent failover, and deployments without service interruption. This technology, adopted by the world's largest digital players, offers you flexibility and robustness comparable to cloud giants' solutions, with the advantage of personalized service and complete control of your data.
services.intro_p4: Environments are individually isolated and secured, allowing peaceful cohabitation of multiple applications while maintaining optimal performance. Our advanced monitoring system offers you complete visibility on resource usage and application performance.

webdb.title: WebDB range: power at the service of your data
webdb.intro_p1: Our WebDB range was specifically designed to meet the most demanding challenges: hosting critical databases under heavy load, web servers supporting intense traffic, and applications requiring ultra-fast response times.
webdb.intro_p2: At the heart of this range, a custom server equipped with an AMD Threadripper processor - an exceptional multi-core architecture - coupled with latest-generation NVMe storage. This combination offers read/write performance that far exceeds traditional solutions, with data access times measured in microseconds.
webdb.intro_p3: The AMD Threadripper, with its multiple cores and threads, particularly excels in parallel processing of complex database queries. Whether you manage large data warehouses, real-time analytics applications, or high-traffic websites, this architecture guarantees you constant responsiveness even under maximum load.
webdb.intro_p4: NVMe storage, meanwhile, eliminates traditional bottlenecks linked to mechanical disks or even classic SATA SSDs. With throughputs that can reach several gigabytes per second (here, more than 7 GB/s with our Samsung NVMe), your applications benefit from near-instant data access, translating into a smooth user experience and optimized processing times.
webdb.intro_p5: This configuration is particularly suited to CRM, ERP environments, e-commerce platforms, data analysis applications, and all use cases where database performance constitutes a critical success factor.
webdb.description: The WebDB range is dedicated to databases and high-traffic web servers, requiring maximum responsiveness and stability.

games.intro_p2: Our custom server features an AMD Ryzen 9 9900X processor, one of the most performant processors of its generation. This chip, built on a cutting-edge architecture, offers a unique combination of high frequencies and numerous cores, ideal for applications that demand both raw power and real-time responsiveness.
games.intro_p3: Ultra-fast NVMe storage completes this configuration by eliminating any disk access latency. For online games, this translates into near-instant loading times and perfect fluidity. For intensive computing applications, it's the assurance that data is immediately available for processors, maximizing the efficiency of each computing cycle.
games.intro_p4: This platform is designed to maintain stable performance even under maximum continuous load. Advanced cooling systems and intelligent power management guarantee optimal thermal stability, an essential condition for critical applications running 24/7.

network.title: A professional fiber network: connectivity without compromise
network.intro_p1: In the modern digital ecosystem, the performance of the most powerful servers becomes useless without network connectivity to match. Our network infrastructure was designed according to the industry's most demanding standards, favoring OM4 duplex fiber optics for its exceptional characteristics: ultra-low latency, maximum stability, and virtually unlimited scaling capacity.
network.intro_p2: Our partnership with Netario (trade name of Netaris SAS) guarantees us symmetrical bandwidth of 8-10 gigabits per second, sized to absorb the most important traffic peaks without any service degradation. This capacity, largely oversized compared to our current needs, offers us considerable room for growth and guarantees you constant service quality.
network.intro_p3: Measured and certified performance: Our regular tests confirm a latency of only 7 milliseconds to Scaleway Paris, placing our infrastructure at the level of the best market solutions. This exceptional performance guarantees optimal responsiveness for your critical applications, whether interactive web applications, real-time APIs, or services requiring precise synchronization.
network.architecture_intro: Our network relies on a layered architecture that combines security, performance and redundancy:
network.fortinet_desc: Fortinet FortiGate 100E: This next-generation firewall constitutes our first line of defense. Beyond simple packet filtering, it integrates advanced intrusion prevention (IPS) functionalities, traffic behavioral analysis, application filtering, and protection against advanced threats. Its high processing capacity guarantees that no performance is sacrificed for security.
network.mikrotik_ccr_desc: MikroTik CCR2004-1G-12S+2XS: This high-performance professional router manages the intelligence of our network. Its advanced dynamic routing, quality of service (QoS) management, and load balancing capabilities allow us to continuously optimize data flows. Integrated redundancy features guarantee service continuity even in case of link failure.
network.mikrotik_crs_desc: MikroTik CRS317-1G-16S+RM: This fully-fibered 10 gigabit switch ensures internal connectivity between our servers. Its "non-blocking" design guarantees that each port can use its full bandwidth without congestion, even when all ports are simultaneously active. This architecture eliminates any bottleneck at the server interconnection level.
network.architecture_conclusion: This multi-layer architecture allows us to offer a unique combination of speed, redundancy and security. Intelligent traffic management automatically optimizes performance, while multi-layer protection systems guarantee bank-level security.

security.title: Security and continuity: your digital assets protected
security.sovereignty_p1: The choice of hosting in France, specifically in the Caen data center, responds to a fundamental requirement: digital sovereignty. Your data remains under French and European jurisdiction, guaranteeing total compliance with GDPR and the strictest regulations regarding personal data protection.
security.sovereignty_p2: This location offers multiple strategic advantages: complete legal control of your data, optimized latency for your European users, and independence from extraterritorial legislations that can compromise the confidentiality of your sensitive information.
security.depth_intro: Our security approach is based on the principle of defense in depth, with multiple layers of protection that mutually reinforce each other:
security.perimeter_desc: The Fortinet FortiGate 100E constitutes our digital shield. This next-generation security solution combines traditional firewall, intrusion prevention system, application filtering, and advanced threat protection. Its integrated artificial intelligence continuously analyzes traffic patterns to identify and block attack attempts, even the most sophisticated.
security.isolation_desc: Proxmox virtualization creates hermetically isolated environments. Each virtual machine evolves in its own secure space, eliminating cross-contamination risks and guaranteeing that the compromise of one environment cannot affect others.
security.monitoring_desc: Our security monitoring systems continuously analyze logs, detect abnormal behavior, and generate instant alerts in case of intrusion attempts or suspicious activity.
security.backup_title: Multi-layer backup strategy: your peace of mind insurance
security.backup_intro: Our backup strategy was designed according to the principle of maximum redundancy, guaranteeing the integrity and availability of your data even in the most unfavorable scenarios:
security.backup_level1_desc: The Longhorn system ensures automatic real-time replication of our internal infrastructure's critical data. This cloud-native technology guarantees that no system data is ever lost, even in case of hardware failure.
security.backup_level2_desc: Your client data is automatically backed up at Infomaniak, a Swiss hosting provider recognized for its exemplary reliability, political neutrality, and scrupulous respect for privacy. This geographic externalization guarantees the protection of your data even in the face of major disasters.
security.backup_level3_desc: For clients with the highest requirements, our backup service via Proxmox Backup Server (PBS) offers total control over the backup strategy. You define your own retention policies, backup frequencies, and restoration tests, with file-level granularity if necessary.
security.sla_desc: We are actively working to guarantee a 99.5% SLA in this launch phase, representing more than 716 hours of uptime per month out of 720 total hours. This commitment, supported by our redundant architecture and proactive monitoring, is accompanied by a continuous improvement roadmap aiming for the industry's highest standards.

ecology.title: Ecological approach: performance and responsibility reconciled
ecology.intro: Our ecological commitment is not a simple marketing argument, but a deep conviction that guides our technical and economic choices. In a digital sector often criticized for its growing carbon footprint, we demonstrate that technical excellence and environmental responsibility can not only coexist, but mutually reinforce each other.
ecology.refurbishing_intro: Our acquisition strategy systematically favors refurbished servers less than ten years old (except for our critical internal infrastructure). This approach presents multiple advantages:
ecology.impact_desc: By extending the useful life of quality professional equipment, we significantly reduce demand for rare natural resources and the energy needed to manufacture new servers. Manufacturing carbon impact often representing 70% of a server's total footprint, this approach divides our environmental impact by 3 to 4.
ecology.performance_desc: Professional HPE ProLiant servers and our custom AMD configurations maintain their exceptional performance well beyond their first decade of use. The manufacturing quality of this equipment guarantees reliability and performance that often surpass new "low-cost" solutions.
ecology.economic_desc: This approach allows us to invest more in critical components (recent processors, fast memory, NVMe storage) while maintaining controlled costs, a benefit we directly pass on to our client rates.
